metadata.title: CVE-2022-47943 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in ksmbd in the Linux kernel 5.15 through 5.19before 5.19.2. There is an out-of-bounds read and OOPS for SMB2_WRITE, whenthere is a large length in the zero DataOffset case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-53-generic - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-5.15.0-53-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-generic - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-generic-64k - 5.15.0-53.59
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-kvm - 5.15.0-1021.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1023-aws - 5.15.0-1023.27
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1023-azure - 5.15.0-1023.29
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1018-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1018.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-lowlatency - 5.15.0-53.59
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-53-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-53.59
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1018-raspi - 5.15.0-1018.20

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-53.59').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1021.26').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1023.27').

linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.28').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.20').
